input: Passage: Yesterday , my family and I went to Iguana Joe ’s . It is a TexMex restaurant with a playground for children as well as good food and drinks . \ \ nWe did n’t make a reservation , but when we arrived at 5 pm we only had to wait about 5 minutes for them to get us a table by the playground . \ \ nFirst , they asked if we wanted drinks . This was the main reason we came ; Iguana Joes is known for creative and tasty drinks . We ordered milk for our kids and I got a peach Margarita with a splash of soda ; they call this a Margatini . \ \ nThe service is very good here and they brought out the drinks really fast . Like always , they were huge and delicious and look pretty enough to take a picture of . The bartenders always put the drinks in giant stemmed glasses and add things like paper umbrellas and cherries to the top . Also the drinks are very colorful . \ \ nWhile drinking , we placed our order of pizza for the kids and fish tacos for us . The food arrived after about 20 minutes and we enjoyed talking and watching the kids play . The kids came back as needed for bites of their pizza and to drink their milk , but mostly they were on the monkey bars and slide . \ \ nAfter awhile we had finished and the waiter took our food and asked if we wanted more drinks . We ordered a second round ; this time I got a Raspberry Margarita and my husband got a Pina Colada . Once again the drinks were served beautifully and were quite colorful . \ \ nFinally we paid the bill , got the kids and headed to the car to go home . We love Iguana Joes for it ’s family friendly atmosphere . Question: Who ordered a Margarita? Option1: the waiter Option2: the author

input: Passage: Ok , my shoes are laced up tight , I ’ve got on my shorts , a cool t-shirt and a headband to keep the sweat off my brow . I stood up next to the girl I had come to the park with and said , “ Ok , I ’m ready when you are . ” . Not at a dead run , not even at a sprint . This was a little slower , but faster than walking . “ Oh , we ’re jogging ” I thought to myself as I sped up just a little bit to catch up with the girl . Down the path we jogged , through the trees and past the benches we snaked our way though the park , our shoes clip clopping beneath us . Thankfully the trees with their leaves extending out like happy little jazz fingers blocked most of the suns heat so I was n’t sweating as bad as I was expecting to , but I could n’t help but wonder if this girl every going to run out of breath . Lap after lap we jogged around that park and with each lap I regretted not stretching before we started out . I was amazed at how effortless she was able to glide through the air , with only the slightest hint of sweat glistening off her brow . By this time , shaded by trees or not , our sustained pace around the park had my shirt drenched in sweat . Finally , after two hours of keeping up with her rhythmic pace I could n’t do it any longer and collapsed on the first bench I could find . Exhausted , out of breath and sprawled out on a park bench I look up , and in the glare of the midday light I see her face with a crooked little smirk on it as she says , “ All done with our warm up jog ? ” Question: Where did the people jog? Option1: park path Option2: downtown
